He lacked experience and clearly wasn't equipped to be a server. It was fly-by order and go. Drinks took another 15 minutes to arrive - mind you this place has two bars and it wasn't that busy. Needless to say the rest of the night was as predictable as the first 30 minutes. We had to order more sparkling water throughout the evening since our server didn't seem to notice anything on the table. We had initially asked to have our dinner paced out but soon realized it was a bad idea bc of the slow, inattentive service. Food was dropped off all at once and left. It was such horrible service. Our bill was $600 for 4 ppl so it wasn't like we weren't eating. The food was fine - not extraordinary while the service was atrocious. Our busser was the only redeeming aspect of the evening. Yes it looks great inside but what's the point if you get horrible service. What a disappointing experience. Never going back.
author: Aech2 O.

description:
I love Spruce, so when I heard they were opening a casual spot in the loin, it was an automatic that I would pay a visit.  

The space is a lot glossy & a little clubby. Though the latter might be my fault for going at 10:30 on a Saturday night.  

First, they deserve major props for their stellar fernet selection.  Top shelf fernet?  $32 a shot.  That's top shelf fernet.  I also couldn't help noticing the ample supply of chartreuse.  So SF old school.  If money is no object, they have a green chartreuse from the 30's that goes for $440 bucks an ounce.  Maybe someday I'll find out how it tastes.

Upstairs vs. downstairs...

The first level, or rather, the level that the entrance is on, is actually the upstairs.  It really sparkles w the ultra shiny, full bar display.  And w the gorgeous light fixture, it's a vision, even from the outside, thanks to the floor to ceiling windows.  It's peppered w several small tables, in addition to the bar seating.  This is the floor to be on if you want to see & be seen.

I preferred the downstairs.  There's another full bar, but it's smaller, & way more intimate.  More tables & bar seating. If you really want privacy while still being able to witness the action, try to score the cozy corner to the left when you reach the bottom of the stairs, all the way to the back (against the back wall & ideal for 2 people, no more than 4).  It's like a miniature living room.  Alternatively, there are larger tables on the other side of the staircase, which you will pass on the way to the restrooms.  While the rest of the joint was packed & noisy, those tables somehow remained quiet & out of the way.

I had just come from dinner, so I didn't try the food yet.  But when I have a 20 dollar glass of Pinot Noir that I think was actually worth 20 dollars (Deovlet, Santa Barbara, 2014), I'm happy.

Nice joint, for sure.  Swanky & cool.  But if you're not into noise or crowds, don't go on Friday or Saturday nights.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Is this really the TL? This place has so much glitz and swank and less of that hipster "I'm trying to make this place look all industrial and minimal purpose"... it would feel right at home in Vegas or LA. Even the majority of the clientele are here wearing a jacket with slacks and dress shoes for the men and fancy cocktail attire for the ladies. Kinda feels like I walked into a tech startup's sales team's holiday party (If you work in that industry, you'll know exactly what I'm talking about). I never thought I would feel underdressed anywhere around that neighborhood.

In any case, you can consider the food here to also be a fancy rendition of bar food. The burger is superb, with lot of juicy meat flavor and a perfectly toasted, charred bun. The other dishes such as their giant cubes of tater tots with tons of fixins on it (reminiscent of Trick Dog's manimal fries) are also pretty solid. Definitely enjoyed that scotch pudding dessert as well.

We had some of the cocktails out of the shaken/stirred section, and that's probably where this place felt a bit short. The drinks were good, but not great. There are better drinks at other bars. With that being said, there are very few places in the entire city that both excel at food and at drinks, so this place is still worth visiting considering that they do a pretty decent job at both.
author: Kazu O.

description: Love! Perfect brunch. Perfect steak dinner (share, it's generous). Beautiful Caesar salad. I'm a neighborhood local and am so stoked this awesome restaurant is on my block.
author: Breana L.

description: This place is AMAZING and has the sweetest most accommodating staff. The drinks were well balanced, the food was out of this world delicious, and the service was fast even on a Friday night?!!!! Will definitely be going back! I must say again the staff was phenomenal and the reservationist was very charming.
author: Cherie J.

description:
Went here with a few friends for dinner. Everyone thought it was ok, but no one was planning on going back. 

The ambiance is nice and cozy. Not too loud. Good for a nice sit down dinner.

The cocktails were ok. The Vieux Carre was as expected, the Green Goblin was sub par. Wine was fine.

Food:
- We had one person in our party who wanted to eat light and hence wanted something vegetarian for the main ... unfortunately, they didn't have anything vegetarian for a main dish; just side dishes. I found that a bit strange, but oh well.
- Tuna tartare: very mediocre dish. Wouldn't recommend it.
- Warm tomato dip: good, interesting flavors ... definitely surprised me.
- Heirloom squash: i liked the texture, but the flavor profile was average.
- Octopus: good dish, albeit, on the small side.
- Crab sandwich: this was a special for the day and was definitely my favorite dish of the night.
- Pork chops: other in the group liked it a lot; i thought it was just ok.
- Brussel sprouts: below average.

Not a bad experience ... just expected more.
author: Ankur V.

description:
I'm attracted to lights.  Traffic lights.  Candlelight dinners.  Spotlights.  But most important, I'm attracted to lights showcasing a wall of liquor.

I sat at the bar after a hard day at work, scanning the bottles of brown liquid happiness that was going to temporarily take my stress away.  Not today I thought...it was going to be a cocktail, chased by a beer.  I'll save the scotch for another time.

Beware that this is a cocktail place, with bar food to accompany the drinks.  Don't come here for the food unless you're fine with an assortment of sliders, buns, and small bites.  It's a lot of flash for the cash, but hey...drink up and shut up.
author: Ron L.

description:
First off, kudos for having the guts to open such a beautiful restaurant in the tenderloin.  The restaurant consists of two floors, a ground level and a basement. The basement has a very clubby feel to it with white tablecloths and nice art  on the walls. The concept is very alcohol-centric: The first floor sports a  huge backbar with an amazing assortment alcohol.  The food is good but the crowd was mostly 30ish corporatist posers.  

   One of our group was clearly disabled and having a hard time walking with a cane. (We had showed up on time for our 9pm reservation and we had now been waiting/standing  25 minutes for our past-due table.) When we plopped our friend down on an empty bar stool we were told curtly that  "all our bar stools are reserved". I explained that my friend  was having a problem standing, needed to sit down , and I wanted to speak to her manager.  After a few moments Mr. Manager showed up and said my friend  would have to move. I was over their attitude by this point & said "Sir, you are a public accommodation and I demand reasonable accommodation for my friend under the American's with Disabilities Act. There is no where for him to move to, our table is 30 minutes  late, so you call your owner, and let him know he has a big problem on his hands....." 

Mr. Manager look startled, but did find us a table in about 2 minutes.  Saratoga needs to clean up their act a bit.
author: Mark E.

description: The food was very good - green beans were so good but other food dishes we ordered were really tasty as well. The service was great. I would recommend it if you want something casual but nice at the same time.
author: Violet D.

description: Great drinks, great food, great service. Anything else? No parking, take Uber or Muni. I've been dining out in SF for 5 years and this has hit the spot. The best bar counter service ever.
author: Vijay B.

description: Emily & Will at the downstairs bar were the best bartenders I've had in a long time. They took the time to chat with me and my boyfriend and gave us some great recommendations for our next few bars. Their service was amazing and the drinks were so fresh and delicious!
author: Laura K.

description:
I came in after dinner for a nightcap so I haven't tried the food yet.  I will say the drinks are good, but the desserts were better.  Service is friendly, ambiance is good, the upstairs with downstairs give it a speakeasy vibe fitting for the neighborhood.  

That said, they need to work out some of the operational stuff.  I think bars at restaurants should be first come-first served.  Save the tables for reservations.  I went on a rainy Friday and was told there was a wait list for the bar then watched as 2 guys, that came in after me, grabbed some empty seats and were served.  That's fine if it's a policy but be consistent.  I ended up leaving and coming back another night with a reservation.
author: Olivia D.

description: Such an original space and cocktail menu! Bartender Emily was top notch, as were the drinks. Totally dug the burger and can't wait to go back to try the 'toga tots and more specialty drinks!
author: Rosalita S.

description: Good cocktails, good music, delicious food!! This place is amazing!! For sure Im gonna show up again and again!!
author: Bruna B.

description:
We tried so many food between the 6 of us and they were mostly great! Nice cocktail and alcohol selection. They had some french toast with Foie gras. Unique and tasty. We had pepper popper after to refresh our palette. Tots were great as others also mentioned, and ceviche was also refreshing. The tomato and bratta cheese dish was tasty! For main, we had mole sauce fried chicken, octopus, beef, burger. With green been, corn, potato as side dish. Each dish was big! Fir dessert, we had the Ho Ho, cherry pie and pudding! We were all stuffed but managed to clean them all up. As it got later, the place got more crowded. Nice bar to hang out to. Downstairs was much quieter.
Small and cozy place. No valet parking was a minus... but there is a parking garage one block away on sutter I think.
author: Akiko I.

description: I wanted to give The Saratoga 5-stars but I just can't.  The food and craft cocktails were very good, but we waited 30 mins for our first round of cocktails and then we were asked to vacate our table the instant our meal was done. Nothing like being rushed out when their service was slow.  And we were celebrating a birthday.  It really left a bad feeling.
author: S S.

description: Short staffed and slow service! The space is hip... attracts tourists and drunkie crowd. The food is ok to good. Parking is very challenging. Pricy for such poor service. I'm sure the young loud and drunk crowd will enjoy.
author: Stefan H.

description:
For me to give a rating of 5 stars everything at an establishment has to truly be exceptional. First visited The Saratoga a couple of weeks ago sitting at the downstairs bar and truly enjoyed the cocktails, shared plates we had and the exceptional bar tender Larissa. We visited again last night, NYE, with a party of 5 and reserved a table upstairs. Was so happy to see that Larissa was making drinks at the upstairs bar and she did not disappoint with all of our parties cocktails. We are especially fond of the "Sibling Rivalry". Everything about our evening at The Saratoga was exceptional. Our wait staff was amazing! Our waiter Michele was wonderful; friendly, knowledgable of all the dishes and extremely efficient at making our time pleasurable. All of the dishes we ordered were exceptional and cooked to perfection we ordered the seared scallops, chicken paillard, NY steak in peppercorn sauce, a kale salad, sauteed kale and tater tots with chorizo. The deserts are wonderful as well as we ordered the Ho-Ho and the Scotchy Scotch Pudding which is off the hook! The atmosphere is upscale and lively and not annoyingly loud which makes dinner more pleasurably. They are also very cognizant and as accommodating as possible with dietary restrictions and food allergies. One of our party is vegetarian and one of our party has a peanut allergy. Michele was great in showing our vegetarian friend what dishes were great for her and he also had an order of the tater tots prepared without the chorizo. He was also great in letting our guest with the peanut allergy know that the tots were cooked in peanut oil and letting her know what dishes were safe for her.

I should also add that the spirits menu is unbelievable with something like 600 different spirits to chose from. We counted 169 different bourbons alone and if sipping an 80 year old chartreuse is your thing, they have that.

Exceptional cuisine, cocktails, spirit selection, staff and ambiance earns The Saratoga 5 stars easily.
author: Steven B.

description: I liked this place! The appetizers were great . The drinks were awesome! We were 7 of us and payed $500 before gratuity. The reason i held back a star was the bartender was very rude when he was checkin my friends Id and it was his birthday. He made a big fuss about his id expiring at 12 a.m and it was 9 o clock when he checked it . Total buzz kill (it was my friends 28th birthday) . Other than that great place . Drinks were alright i ve ha better . I would recommend this place for the food
author: Dev B.

description: We rarely venture into the TL after dark, but I'm thankful we did for this restaurant! Loved everything we ordered -- loaded tatertots, michelada mussels, the burger, even the dessert! My fiance kept ordering drinks because he wanted to try them all too.. HA! And they were all amazing! Needless to say, we'll be back next month to try more items on the menu..
author: Kim I.

description: Cheap bar snacks during happy hour. Pretty good drinks and beer/wine selection. Food overall just just so-so.
author: Joe B.

description:
I love this place! The atmosphere; the cocktail bars both upstairs and downstairs. The owners did a fabulous job with the place; I can not wait to be back again!

The staff is delightful, helpful and knowledgeable. I felt like I was treated to one of the best service experiences. 

I wish they keep all the Christmas decorations all the lights make it feel so warm and welcoming. 

Fantastic whiskey and scotch selection!
author: Anelya S.

description:
Had the pleasure of visiting The Saratoga with my wife when we were both in San Francisco on business.  Beautiful venue, great food, and amazing drinks.  We enjoyed our experience so much that we came back a second time before our flight out. 

The cocktail program here is the real standout.  We gave the bartender an idea of what each of us preferred and the cocktails she came up with did not disappoint.  My wife still says that the "Green Goblin" is one of the best cocktails she has ever had.  I was impressed with the Chartreuse selection and the Manhattans were spectacular.

We are looking forward to visiting The Saratoga again next time we're in the area!
author: John K.

description: We had dined at Saratoga twice this year since our first disappointing experience there last year and I have to say, both the food and service have improved significantly. The standout dishes are tuna crudo, lamb shank and sea bass. Also, this year we got seated upstairs and it contributed to the overall dining experience.
author: EG P.

description: The drinks were very good but $15 for a Hanger 1 vodka soda is ridiculous.  Overall it was waaaaayyy too expensive, even for San Francisco.  Won't go back unfortunately.
author: April R.

description: Best place in the Bay Area 5 stars service 5 stars food 6 stars Managment huge spirit and cocktail selection super cool bartenders this is a beautiful spot with 360 degrees choices. Amazing Sunday Brunch I love Saratoga.
author: Michele B.

description:
4.5 STARS

My girlfriend was lucky enough to get invited to The Saratoga's grand opening. What does that mean? Everything was free! Luckily, she decided to invite me! She made a reservation for two a couple days prior for Saturday, November 5th at 6:45pm. (Prices below were what was listed on the menus we received.)

*'Toga Tots: fiscalini cheddar, chorizo, scallion ($8)
*Spicy Pork Belly Bun: carolina gold bbq sauce ($7)
*Chicken Liver Toasts: honeycrisp apple butter, endive, walnuts ($9)
*Baby Kale, Quinoa, and Persimmon Salad: crispy bacon, egg, gorgonzola dolce ($13)
*New Caledonian Blue Prawns Baked in Rock Salt: shaved escarole, garlic-chili vinaigrette ($18)
*The Saratoga Burger: taleggio cheese, slaw, onion bun ($15)
*Flannery's Dry Aged New York Steak: smothered in cognac-peppercorn sauce ($28)
*Fried Apple Hand Pie: cream cheese frosting ($9)
*Scotchy Scotch Scotch Pudding: black label scotch caramel ($9)

We actually didn't order the prawns, but I'm glad they served them! I adore head on prawns, so this ended up being one on my favorite dishes. The liver toast was great as well. Creamy and flavorful. Everyone knows I love greens, so I had to get a salad. The soft boiled egg made it that much richer and delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly, but the sauce was a touch too salty. The burger was moist and tender. I loved the slaw on it. Had a great pickle/relish flavor. The tots were our first dish. I liked the ingredients, but I wished they were crispier. The insides were also a little mushy. My least favorite dish was the pork buns. Sounded great on the menu, but they were basically small bbq pork buns. More bread than meat which I didn't enjoy. As for dessert, the scotch pudding was so good! I love scotch and I love caramel, so this was my kind of dessert. The apple pie was nice and crispy, though I didn't love the cream cheese frosting. I would have rather had something more comforting, like an ice cream.

*Japanese Blended Highball: yuzu, mint, soda ($14)
*Vieux Carre: rye/cognac/sweet vermouth/angostura & peychaud's bitters ($13) ×3
*The Walking Dead: rum/lemon/papaya/pineapple/pomegranate/tiki bitters ($14) ×2

Of course we had to have drinks! I asked the server what he recommended and he suggested the vieux carre. Great drink to start off the night. I liked it so much, I had two of them! My gf started with the highball. She didn't really like it that much, so she moved o to the vieux carre as well. For our next round, I asked the server what he suggested as a follow up and we decided on the walking dead. I'm normally not a fan of rum, but this was delicious! Pretty as it was served with a flame on the pineapple. It was fruity, but very balanced and boozy. And I normally don't like fruity cocktails. For dessert, our server recommend two glasses of Champagne. I didn't catch the kind, but it was nice and dry, which I prefer.

Service was excellent. Our server was sweet and attentive. Such a friendly guy. And the bar at The Saratoga is beautiful. Wish I could have such a pretty bar at home! They gave us our comped tab at the end of the night. Total with our one bottle of sparkling water and one bottle of still water was under $250. We ended up tipping him $50 before we left for the night.

I'd say the food was more a 4, but the service was so good, I'm rounding this review up to 5 stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
Upon arriving tonight for our 6oclock dinner reservation, I checked in with the host who then proceeded to answer the phone and seat other guests before asking if I would like to be shown to the table or communicating that I have to wait for the rest of my party to arrive. Finally after standing there looking confused, I asked if I was supposed to stand or if I can be seated. Her response was, "it's up to you". I requested to sit, and as I was being shown to the table she tells me there is another reservation at 7:30 so we need to be finished by then. 

She then tells everyone else in my party the same as we arrived. Our waitress then proceeds to tell us 2 more times that we have to be finished by 7:30. 

Our food takes 30 minutes to arrive, which by the way was mediocre and nowhere near deserving of the price. While my friend is still eating and as a drink is being being delivered to me at the table, our waitress then again tells us that "it's 7:20" ... we let her know we thought it was very rude to keep reminding us of this.

Other than this our drinks were delicious and our waitress was very attentive. It wasn't her fault but it also isn't our fault that the hostess accidentally booked two parties too close to each other. We spent a lot of money to feel rushed. I won't ever be back.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Top notch service, food and of course cocktails without the pretension. 

Sip a Rare whiskey solo at the bar and house their insanely delicious unconventional burger....
Bring mom for a luxurious 4 course dinner and bottle of wine....
Gather with a group of friends and lose hours ordering specialty cocktails - the underrated chicken sliders and other easily shareable snacks....

However you wish to enjoy the Saratoga it would be hard to not leave full & happy. 

It's refreshing to go to a bar that's not run by a pretentious kid with attitude that rolls his / her eyes at someone's 'uncool' drink order... 
Enjoy your white wine spritzer ! 
They'd also be happy to recommend some lesser known spirits or a different variation of your usual libation. 

Food and cocktails can easily be ruined by a lesser than experience. 
Don't foresee that happening here - hospitality is first. Great marriage of old school hospitality and charm with creative and inventive twists from ambiance to menu. 
 
Will always be a solid go to in SF - especially that neighborhood. 
LOVE that Mezcal highball too
author: Larissa W.

description: Great service, food and drinks! Nice modern interior with 2 bars. Fairly decent size for the city.
author: R W.

description:
I can't believe I've never been here before today! Amazing cocktails, out of this world food, and a super cool interior. You must check out the bar in the basement!!! Jason was our bar keep and server, he was very friendly and informative! Started with the drinks, Brooklyn-5*, burbon highball-5+*, walking dead -5*, decaf coffee -3*(You can't be great at everything) 
For food had the tots-4*, chicken sliders -5+*, asparagus salad -5*, ho ho's-5*
So many tastey sounding menu items,  so little time...
I will be back to try more, soon!!
author: Amanda M.

description:
I'm glad my last Friday night plans for happy hour got quickly nixed.  Taking two close friends out for drinks and bites for belated birthdays turned into so much fun.  The lower level bar was where the fun was at.  Our expert bar/mixologists knew all the right things to suggest for our 2 hour soiree at the bar.  For $200 out the door with tip, 3 of us ate enough, drank a lot and met new friends.  

Def a little too far into the Loin for my taste, but this area is quickly going gentrified and the businesses/restos are turning upscale.  We will be back soon!
author: A W.

description: This review has been a long time coming. The Saratoga has definitely become our favorite spot. It is beautiful! Drinks are amazing and the bartenders really know their stuff. Everything we have eaten off the menu has been tasty as well. It can be busy but we try to go early. The downstairs bar is usually our first choice. Definitely a gem!
author: J W.

description: I really enjoyed this place. At first I was disappointed to be led downstairs since upstairs was not that busy. Turned out to be very cozy downstairs, I liked. Vieux Carre was super yummy, although my husband didn't like his and said it was lacking.. it was good. Very good Brussels sprouts, on the saucier side compared to other versions of roasted sprouts. Good fries. Although the gentleman next to us was about a minute too late in telling us to get the tater tots. Our waitress was very approachable, I was worried this place was gonna be snooty, and friendly. I think the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the menu is a bit more of a bar menu than I had expected. I'll definitely go back.
author: Tracy C.

description:
When I found out there was a swanky bar/restaurant nearby named after my hometown I immediately had to bookmark it and ended up stopping by with a friend on a Friday night. I did not have a reservation but they put me down for the waitlist and estimated a one and a half our wait time - they do take your number down, which is nice so you can go to a nearby bar to wait. Well by the time I got to Upcider down the street and ordered my drink they called me for my table! The wait was only 30 minutes!

My friend and I were sat in the upstairs bar area right next to the door at a small table. The atmosphere is very lively, more bar-like than restaurant-like. They have a lot of smaller sized tables upstairs and I saw some larger tables and couch seating downstairs. Seems like a good place for a date!

We ordered some drinks, the Walking Dead came out on fire which was a nice Snapchat moment!

Foodwise we ended up getting a bunch of smaller items to share and I enjoyed them all. Toga Tots are a must, the fried chicken sliders were good as well. The chicken liver toast was not the best I've ever had but I did enjoy the hamachi crudo.

All in all it was a great spot to eat on a Friday night and the fact that it's so well located with tons of other bars nearby is a major plus. I'm sure I'll be back!
author: Christina L.

description:
I live on the same block and have watched this space go from boarded-up nothing to the beautiful restaurant it is now. So there was lots of excitement when we went on opening night. Did it live up to expectations? Yes. And that's both a good thing - and bad. 

The Saratoga does everything you'd expect from a mid-high range restaurant/bar hybrid in SF. The retro-modern fixtures, the suited staff, the loud - let's be honest - terrible music, you've kinda seen it all before. And sure, it works. But is it groundbreaking or memorable? No. 

We ordered five plates to share between two, ranging from apps like the deliciously salty toga tots, to the larger spice-encrusted chicken paillard. The fried apple pie dessert was a fun nod to the classic McDonald's apple pie - and I don't hate it. Drinks are tasty, but the pours are a little on the smaller side. 

At $130 for two people, it'll probably be a while before we go back. But I also know it takes a lot of guts to open in this neighborhood, so yes, I can drink to that.
author: Ky W.

description:
Beautiful two-level bar/restaurant.  Pick your vibe--the airy and open upstairs bar and dining room, with gorgeous unique chandelier focal point...or go downstairs, for a cozier lounge-like feel and a smaller but no less dramatic marble bar.

The Saratoga is one of my favorite spots to go for a drink with friends.  And the food is so good, we always end up getting something to eat, even when we didn't plan to.  I'm gluten-free, and while there's definitely some stuff on the menu I can't have, the servers and bartenders are always very knowledgable about what's safe for me to eat, and happy to make alterations to the dishes as needed.  Current faves are the octopus and the pork chop...and to drink, try the 'Look at the Flowers.'  I've never been for brunch, but it's high up on my to-do list!
author: Julia P.

description:
Fresh. Whether you're looking for a vibrant bar scene, a hip place to grab a bite, or a more intimate setting to dine and grab a drink, The Saratoga has it all. There are two floors that create separate ambiances to fit the vibe you are looking for. 

Before getting into food and drinks, I want to give a shout out to the great staff. They were some of the most professional service providers I have interacted with in SF.

Drinks are flavorful and crafted with care. If you are with a group, you must try the "Cocktail Bill" Boothby Bowl. It is beautiful AND delicious. My photo attached does not do it justice. 

Of the "snacks" on the menu my favorites were: Toga Tots, Spicy Pork Belly Buns, and the Seven-spice chicken sliders. 

And the burger needs its own paragraph, but I will let the reviews speak to it. Just get it. You won't regret it.
author: Shannon H.

description: Fun and energetic atmosphere with friendly staff and delicious food. We had a great night out and managed to scarf down the whole dessert menu between the four of us! You'd be dumb donkey to skip the deep fried apple pie pocket. Don't be that donkey!
author: Jack J.

description: Great  cocktails and attentive service. Came without reservations but was able to find a spot.
author: Costel C.

description:
The upstairs bar is So Beautiful! We began with cocktails and then added bar snacks.  The special the night we were there was soft shell crab sandwich! So lucky as it's 1 of my fav.

Additionally there is a second bar down stairs.
author: Nat D.

description: Checked this place out on a Friday evening. The scallops were very good and well portioned. The appetizers all came out cold, though. Apparently it's an issue they've been having and can't figure out why? Maybe just run the food out when it's ready?! Very short staffed so wait times are long.
author: Rob M.

description:
We had a wonderful and memorable meal here. Our table had the burger, fried chicken mole, the mussels, corn, burratta and the pork chop. Everything was so delicious but our favorite was the pork chop. 

The ambiance was perfect. Low lighting, comfortable table with the music at the perfect level. I would say this is a great date spot. 

All the staff was very accommodating and friendly from the hostess, the bartender and the Busser. 

Only criticisms were that I felt the server was a bit rushed with us and that the desserts were not as delicious as the dinner (butterscotch pudding and the chartreuse donut).

I will be back soon.
author: Leilani B.

description: A very nice bar, good ambience, attentive staff etc. This place has got all the ingredients to be a hit. However, 3* from me because of the rip off prices. $21.08 for a beer and a G&T!!! I mean, how can that be justified, even in this city, it's just robbery. Cannot go back for that reason. Sad.
author: Simon P.

description:
It's a pretty place in a dark part of the city. 

Last night (9:15-10:30) it was full of people who seemed to be three drinks in: shrieking at each other, spilling stuff, and falling into the tables. I've seen it like that before: this is a bros-night-out place. Every 15-20 minutes, the loud sound of breaking glass cut through the yelling. (Sometime a patron had dropped something, but the staff were breaking things, too.)

We ordered the ribeye ($36), the burger, the spicy fries, and the snap peas. Companion had a dirty martini and I had a half glass of Bordeaux ($16/glass).

The ribeye is billed as "marbled, aged, prime." I asked for medium rare. It arrived thin-cut, dry, gristly throughout, medium-well, and barely warm. Pretty much inedible. We were sitting at the bar engaged in conversation, and were largely ignored, so didn't have a chance to say anything about it. There are several places in town to get a great ribeye: eg. Rich Table, Monsieur Benjamin. This is not one of them.

The fries, accompanied by a variant of cucumber raita, were nicely spiced but unremarkable. Go to M. Benjamin for frites.

The Bordeaux seemed young, thin, and not really ready to drink. This is a cocktail place - skip the wines.

The staff is attractive, and the snap peas are delicious. The cocktails might be good. But I will not likely go back soon.
author: Susan G.

description:
We shared a special evening here on the night of our engagement. Will, the bartender (who also served our dinner) went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make our evening one to remember. The comfort food and amazing cocktails were A+. We were even given a dessert donut and a champagne toast, along with a congratulatory card! 

We will definitely be back to The Saratoga; I hope Will is still there!
author: Jonathan S.

description: This place is fantastic! The food is unreal. The chicken slider is so delicious it is the perfect size and literally melts in your mouth. The atmosphere is great very hip. The service staff is always nice and really knows their stuff. Great place to grab dinner and drinks. Miko the manager is incredible he is always so kind and accommodating! He is half the reason we keep coming back! They should keep him around for as long as they can!
author: Jazlyn H.

description: Beautiful Art Deco inspired space. Solid simple comfort food. Good selection of whiskeys. Reminds me of a romantic film noir setting.
author: Eric C.

description: The most wonderful service at the bar. Had the burger with extra lettuce as suggested by the lovely bartender.
author: Yoli V.

description: Really enjoy this place. Make sure you make a reservation or you will not get in. You can only make reservation by calling which is annoying for these days.
author: A Nicole M.

description: This is a beautiful bar with imaginative cocktails and the most extensive list of spirits I've seen. The wine and short beer list works too. We were here for a kinda splurge dinner drawn by the dry aged steak on the menu and interesting small plates. The tots were tasty as advertised. And while the tomato dip wasn't quite what we expected, the flavor absolutely worked. However a special shrimp taco had a mix of flavors but none of them was shrimp, just crunchy bits. And for me the steak was a complete disappointment. Ordered very rare it was barely rare. (They didn't check until about halfway through the course.) Plus it was smothered in the peppercorn sauce which somehow took away from any sear on the steak. It wasn't that tender either. May go back for a drink and a burger.
author: Sally S.

description:
I've now been here twice: once for drinks/snack, once for full on dinner.  Both times we sat at the bar on the ground floor.

The cocktails are lovely, but I was disappointed by the conspicuous dearth of libations including Chartreuse, considering the fact that the Saratoga is (apparently) focused on Chartreuse, owing to the crazy Chartreuse list and the prominently displayed wall o' chartreuse.  I happen to love the stuff, so I was very much looking forward to having an oyster of a cocktail list-world to choose from, but sadly there was only one.  So I ordered it, and it was GOOD, but, you know, choices are better.  I happen to like bourbon and chartreuse together, and the one cocktail with it was a vodka base.

The food.  Guys.  The food.  It's good.  OK. It's real good. Like super, really, extra, good.  The menu is somewhat unsuspecting.  It's maybe not the most eye-popping menu on its face.  But everything is simply scrumptious and perfectly executed.  Case in point: the tots.  So like, tots are having a moment right now and I guess "totchos" are the new hotness.  These are not that.  These are handmade shredded potato cubes, fried to perfection, super crispy outside, perfectly tender potatoey center.  Somehow the edges on those potato cubes are sharper than a drill Sergeant's hospital corners.  I don't know how they construct these tots, I only know they taste good.  The fixins they come with send them right over the top.  You gotta get these tots.  They're really more of a gorgeous potato croquette, if we're going for accuracy.

Anywho!  There was a tomato dip, bagna cauda, thing which was AMAHZING.  Like, the most tomatoey thing I've ever eaten.  Like, tomato distilled to its most essential, that you can dip bread into.  I was into it.  I would have liked to actually bathe in this bagna cauda.

There were other things too, we over did it, big time, but it was worth it.  Go there. Eat the things, drink the drinks, you won't regret it. 

Next time I'll shoot for a spot downstairs as it was much quieter and more intimate.  There's another bar down there, too, FYI.
author: Rachel S.

description: Brandon and staff made our evening amazing!  The food, cocktails and ambiance were over the top. Do yourself a favor and get over there soon!! Gorgeous bar upstairs and downstairs!!
author: Phyllis R.

description:
One of the most phenomenal meals that I have had the pleasure of having in several months in San Francisco. This place has nailed everything. 

Ambiance: 5 stars. Beautiful bar and dining area, very comfortable seats and a cool vibe.
Food: Delicious.  No need to elaborate, try it all.
Service: The servers were SUCH a joy and gave us great recommendations.  

Will be back!
author: Maggie P.

description: I went here for the first time several months back and just getting to this review. There is a special memory to the one time I was there, so my 5 star could be a influenced by that...lol. It is a solid 4-5 star place to me regardless of that. I only had drinks and an app here, so I can't say anything about dinner, but I still remembering enjoying the drinks and app very much. The ambience was nice and the service was great - from the guy who made sure to open the door when I arrived and when I left, the host who gave me her two cents on where to sit based on why I was there, and the waitress that served us. I would definitively go back and recommend to others.
author: Kat C.

description:
It used to be our favorite go-to spot for environment and pretty solid food/menu. Then they took their chicken mole off the menu which we thought was their best dinner item. Very disappointed...

The restaurant then contacted me and stated they would make it upon special request with advance notice. I would say that's going above and beyond. Sounds like they are trying to make improvements constantly which is awesome
author: Ryan S.

description: For sure was my fav spot on my trip!! The ambience is great and the food was delicious. The staff took such good care of us also. A must try are the ribs and the mole!!!! Definitely give it 5 stars!!!!
author: Victoria R.

description: Stumbled upon this gem after bar hopping through the Fillmore. Their drink and food menus are expansive, where every option has you licking your chops. I ordered a couple of dishes off of their snack menu: the beef tartare, pork bun, and fish crudo. The tartare was exceptional: Asian flavors with homemade, salty kettle chips - the perfect textural and flavor contrasts. The pork bun was pretty good, a lot different than baked pork buns you get at a Chinese bakery in SF. The dough was crispy on top and thick on the bottom, but the flavors were awesome and the mustard based sauce on the side really made the dish. The crudo, on the other hand, I could have done without. Though pretty to look at, the fish was not cut thin enough. Overall, this was a good meal accompanied by a delicious cocktail that just makes you feel freakin fabulous. I will definitely be back.
author: Adriana G.

description:
Ate dinner hear at the downstairs bar.  Wifey and I were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and drinks.  The cocktails are really good, and different enough that they alone are worthy of stopping in.  Meanwhile we are some appetizers and loved the Tater tots, Kale Salad and chicken sliders.  I also got a burger, which was only so so (but every burger is now ho-hum after having eaten Plan Check burgers).  

There's not many restaurants that we go to and I look forward to coming back, but The Saratoga will be on the frequent dining list.
author: Todd W.

description: Fabulous Restaurant! If you want a chic night out in Sam Francisco, this is your spot. One of the bartenders, Will Morgan made me the delicious cocktail. I highly recommend the avenue! So delicious!! I would give this place, 10 stars if I could.
author: Carlotta W.

description:
The place is really cool, and the cocktails are amazing. The space is gorgeous with perfect lighting and the seats are comfortable.  The beef tartare was really great as was the kale salad. I liked their chicken sliders and tater tots though I don't think I'd do the sliders again. It was fine but just not that great. 

Service was top notch and servers were very well trained. High quality stuff from the makers of Village Pub and Spruce. Great job.
author: Sean K.

description: Location was just around the corner. Interior was stunning. Loved the drinks. Food was alright. But I will head there for drinks.
author: Kalyana K.

description:
This place is legit. 

I came to the Saratoga when I had absolutely no right to be going out: I had just returned from over a month of traveling, I was feeling wildly introverted and it was a Friday night. Needless to say, checking out a hip venue didn't seem likely in the cards.

But I'm glad we came here.

We were well taken care of at the Saratoga. Despite being full of people, we still managed to find a nice corner to sit in where a really friendly server took our orders with a smile (literally... not a figure of speech). I ordered the Sibling Rivalry (Rye, Canton Ginger, St. Germain, Regan's & Peychaud Bitters; $13) and we all agreed it was the best drink. It soothed my soul.

So if you want a place to chill that's classy, hip, yet comfortable, come to this joint. Saratoga, I think I love you.
author: Keane L.

description: This place is amazzzing!!! Food and presentation was awesome. The Mole was my favorite. Service was incredibly too.. I will go back next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Susana B.

description: This place is amazing! Food was excellent!  Service and atmosphere were perfect! Will definitely be back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Margo A.

description: I liked this place. Great ambience, service, drinks and food. I was impressed with the server Liz. She explained several of the menu items and gave suggestions. We were very pleased. The side salad was a palate surprise! We also enjoyed the chicken sliders and tots. A great treat at the end is to order one of their aged chartreuse shots! It goes great with any of their desserts. I definitely plan to return. Especially to try their new Sunday Brunch.
author: Cat M.

description: One of my favorite places in the city! The food is always great, the liquor selection is amazing, and the employees are wonderful.
author: Dan M.

description:
The Saratoga is undoubtedly on the top of my list of favorite bars in San Francisco. The atmosphere is sophisticated yet intimate, making it the ideal choice for both professional and personal occasions.

The service is unbeatable, and arguably some of the best I've experienced in the city. I have a dietary restriction that oftentimes makes dining out a challenge. The waitstaff here is always so accommodating of this restriction, making sure to point out what I can eat, and what they can modify for me. They are extremely knowledgeable about the ingredients in every dish on the menu. The food here is a lovely twist on comfort food. I highly recommend the Spanish octopus and the New York Steak.

The bartenders here are among the friendliest I've engaged with, and they make the most impeccable and beautiful cocktails. My personal favorites are the Free Trade Agreement, and The Walking Dead (they light a pineapple on fire!)

I can't say enough positive things about the Saratoga. It has become a staple among my friends and family for happy hours, cozy dinners, and late night drinks.
author: Liza P.

description: I have been to The Saratoga on many occasions and wanted to share my experience of it with yelp.  I dine out in the city often, and what strikes me most is how often I am disappointed with the service that I receive.  For sure, I dine out for the food, the drinks, the atmosphere of a place... but what really gets me returning to a restaurant or bar again and again is the hospitality that I receive.  The staff at the Saratoga are always gracious and always make me feel welcome.  The drinks are killer, the food awesome, and the ambiance is wonderful - but what really sets them about is their service.  Kudos to them!
author: Emo A.

description: Went tonight for my birthday 1st time we thought it's a weekday a Tuesday not needing a reservation because it's almost at the middle of the week. Got there and basically we got told tables  are reserved and bar seats and corner seats are the only available ones. So I went to open table and what do I find? Open seats for two in 15mins. Odd right? Well yah I did made reservation hubby went to the hostess and said we have reservation well she told him that she was surprised that it allowed us to do that. Well maybe because when we look at that open table app it shows there were open reservations between 8pm-9pm which will be ample time that we will spend there. But then she needs to give us a table now because we have reservations. Waited for a little bit and while we wait we ordered some cocktails which is one of the reasons why I gave it one of the stars since drinks were tasty. Got on our tiny tiny table of course shoved in a corner server she was nice that's what the second star is for I was debating at first because our food came so late and cold plus she was more attentive to the table that was drinking heavily. Then we looked at a two page menu and 98% of the menu book consists of different kinds of cocktails and other alcoholic beverages. Ordered a snack and two main dishes first menu was really pathetic. Food ordered steak, hamburger and tater tots? Verdict it was Blah best thing we ate were the tater tots. That's why I didn't give it another star cause food sucked! Oh yah Did I mention it was my birthday? First time here and wanted to have a good experience since it had such a great review in yelp. Well, by the way we got treated when we first got there that should already be a sign not to push through and being treated that way on your special day that was a huge mistake I wouldn't want to spend anymore money on a place that treat you like shit! That's why sometimes it's good to stick to the great places you know and not take a risk and just have a very disappointing experience on your special day. I think giving it two stars is still very generous. Worst dining experience we've ever had to date!
author: Dawn M.

description:
Finally walked in to try the 'new' spot & lounged around for a bar stool to become available. 

Overall A-ok (as yelp puts it)! Food, nothing that stood out and your usual drinks!
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Great new bar near tendernob. Definitely recommend getting a cocktail here with friends. Beautiful art all over the walls. Also yummy burgers.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Pretty shocked by all the amazing reviews this place has. My friend and I visited for the first time on a Tuesday night - it was very full with a pretty heavy tech scene. The place itself is nice but I wasn't super impressed with the ambiance - it has the look of most hipster places that cater to a 30+ crowd (which isn't a bad thing, just saying it isn't very unique!)

The wine list started at $18 by the glass which is insane. My friend even sent back her first glass because she didn't like it. My cocktail (I think the Brooklyn) was very very good and def a highlight of the night. We ordered the kale salad, pickled veggies and steak tartare. None were that great. 

Our waitress was good, service was good.

Overall, giving it 3 stars because it is overpriced, not interesting and didn't stand out.
author: Heather C.

description: It is so wonderful to find out this restaurant has good food and service. After we tried the 1st, we felt we want to go back again sometime soon since it is right next to our area. For me to give a rating of 5 stars everything. The service was truly be exceptional, it was super nice customer service, as well the good.  We were sitting at the downstairs for party two of us, enjoyed the food and truly enjoyed the cocktails. Looking forward to try their other dishes.
author: Meichelle L.

description:
This place is Vibe-y. It's got that swagger...It's where the cool kids are and everyone has those shoes you want and are rocking that perfect cat eye look you've been working on. 

That said, the food is good/fine--we only ordered apps (which you can totally do btw and leave full). I hear the mains are just so-so (even our waitress said she prefers the apps to the mains).  But we loved the parker house rolls, the chicken sliders and the pork belly buns.

So what you do is: go here if you need a cool spot to meet some friends for great drinks and a bite to eat--the bar is legit in it's own right. Don't go here for the food, it's just not the reason this place is hot.
author: Lola C.

description:
5 stars for the drinks! WOW. The highball cocktails are fantastic! My boyfriend and I ended up trying all of them and we had a hard time picking our favorite! Each was well balanced, well thought out, and very well executed. 

3 stars for the food- we ordered the beef tartare with kimchi which sounded interesting and just tasted a bit off. I applaud them for trying to be different, and it worked in a sense because it did make me order it.. but it was just too funky. And the potato chips it came with were so overly salty that it took away from the delicacy tartare is known for. We also ordered the pickled things, which was delicious... but more "soaked in vinegar and simple syrup" than actually pickled. The best thing we had were the rolls with olive butter!!!! SO GOOD! I could have eaten 100 of them.

And of course, the inside is absolutely beautiful. It is a stunning space. And the service was beyond excellent- which is why they deserve the full 5 stars. 

Will be back for sure!!! (And will order some entrees instead of sticking to the starters.)
author: Rachel M.

description: Delicious food in a really cool space. Taking off one star because it seems like they still need to work out some post-opening kinks - we had a reservation for 2 & had to wait over 20 minutes for our table (which is fine, we weren't in a rush) so went to the bar for a round of cocktails (Walking Dead is amazing). We were told we could bring the drinks to the table & it would be added to our bill. One of the bartenders followed us to our table and scolded us in front of the other tables for not paying (he thought we were trying to skip out on the tab). VERY awkward. We will still be back and will hopefully have better service at the bar!
author: Sarah U.

description: Great vibes, delicious food, yummy drinks and great service (shout out to Mandy). Must try the pretzel and hamachi!
author: Loan V.

description: We came in for a casual dinner last friday and had the most AMAZING service. Mandy (one of the managers) gave us the super interesting background on the building and how the restaurant concept came about! she also poured us a complimentary drink, and had really great recommendations. We loved everything we ate and the atmosphere is perfect for date night or a group of people. We will be back for sure!
author: Tara H.

description: Love the design and decor. My husband and I had dinner at the bar. I don't remember either of the bartenders names but they were excellent and personable. My husband had the burger which was pretty incredible. I had the octopus, which,unfortunately was not. It was way too tough. But that was the only miss.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
As a bar, this is a 4 to 5 star place.  Gorgeous bar and decor, great cocktails, bartenders, and a lively atmosphere.  Definitely worth a stop for a drink or two.  

As a restaurant, this is 2 to 3 stars.  The food completely misses the mark.  It's overpriced, improperly seasoned, and the menu could use a serious overhaul.  I love a good parker house roll and this wasn't it.  It was not warm, buttery, and soft as they should be.  The kale salad with persimmons desperately needed the persimmons to be grilled and the salad also lacked acid/brightness.  The toga tots were the only dish we liked, but who doesn't like tator tots?  The prawns were nothing special and overpriced for the portion size.  Even the dessert (Ho Hos) were sad and uninspired.  I get that this menu is supposed to be dressed up American classics, but at the price point, there could be a lot better inspiration and direction.   

Bottom line: Go for drinks and maybe the dolled up tater tots, and then go eat dinner elsewhere.
author: Karen W.

description:
TL;DR Great service, food was delicious, reasonable pricing, loved the selection of cocktails and whiskey. Also loved the ambiance and their liquor display!! (Another reviewer said it was overpriced, I disagree. Remember to compare fairly and where you are eating. This is SF and it seems they put a lot of work into sourcing high quality ingredients in their food and drinks. The $$$ is accurate, it's between $30-$60 per person.) Yes, we had a full belly too!

I live 4 blocks north from this place so I was excited to see it pop up on my yelp radar. I had a reservation at 8:30PM but unfortunately I wasn't seated until 9:10PM (maybe a one off). At first I was a little disappointed but they quickly made it up through their amazing service. The servers and hostess was apologetic and they quickly started off our table with complimentary Toga Tots. We were going to order this anyway so we were even more surprised they gave us two orders on the house! They also threw in some Cracker Jack popcorn with our desserts AND ended our dining experience with complimentary green and yellow Chartreuse. - It was strong, a tiny bit medicinal, and refreshing. Ashley (our server) really made sure we had the the best experience. Honestly it made me forget that we even waited for our table and prompted me to write this 5 star review. Big thanks to Ashley, the hostess and the other server with a beard! This was a better service than some of the Michelin star places I've been to so we made sure to tip big! I hope they stay consistent.

If you want more details, keep reading!

Here's what we had:

Drinks: 
Avenue, Bijou, Brooklyn (All very, VERY good, they have a great selection of Japanese whiskey too!)

Snack: 
Warm Parker House Roll -  (4/5 served with whipped kalamata olive butter. so good)
Shoestring Potatoes - (4/5 crispy, not too salty or greasy, well seasoned)
Toga Tots - (5/5 LOVE THIS, reminds me of my grade school days)

Vegetable:
Poached Tomato - (5/5 LOVE, seems simple but its bursting with flavor [bet it has good margins lol])
Baby Kale, Quinoa and Persimmon Salad (5/5 LOVE! I think the persimmon was marinated, the other toppings and dressing was perfect!) 

Meaty:
Mussels cioppino (5/5 I've had my fair share of mussels in Brussels so this was the most tender mussels I've had in SF!)
Chicken Paillard (3.5/5 chicken was tender, flavor was on point, but the skin was too charred)
The Saratoga Burger (3.5/5 burger was good, the meat was well cooked, they noticed we were sharing and so our burger came cleanly split)

Sweet: - all yummy depending on your preference
Fried Apple Pie 
Scotch Pudding 
Ho Hos
Cracker Jack

This is my longest review but well deserved. Welcome to the neighborhood Saratoga!
author: Shelley C.

description:
The Saratoga is a swank bistro from the folks who brought us Spruce.  The bi-level venue is gorgeous and has an up-tempo vibe, great service, an active bar scene, and very good food.  The clientele is composed of swells, couples out on a date, groups partying at the bar, and even single diners like yours truly.  

My meal started with an appetizer of bagna-cauda poached tomato that came swimming in garlic cream and basil.  On the side was slices of grilled levain that one could either dip in the sauce or spread the tomato onto.  This was a lovely plate of food with just the astringency needed to liven the appetite.  Score one for The Saratoga.  

Next up was the dry aged New York steak medium rare that came surmounted and surrounded by a cognac peppercorn sauce.  This huge chunk of perfectly cooked steak is of a suitable size for sharing by two or three guests.  Being alone I ate the entire steak and enjoyed every bite. 

To accompany the steak, I ordered a second appetizer: the warm chantenay carrot salad with avocado, toasted seeds and vadouvan.  Here, I over ordered (my server let me know this) but what the hell it sounded like a great plate of food.  And I was correct.  The salad was superb.  

If you order as I did The Saratoga is not inexpensive but it is less so than Spruce.  If you are rational you can have a cocktail, a few of the smaller plates, an appetizer or two and get out inexpensively. 

It would be appropriate to close by noting that the serving sizes here are quite generous.  So there you have it: great venue; wonderful service; a feel-good vibe; and wonderful food.
author: David D.

description:
Great atmosphere, friendly service, great food and drinks! 

There is a vast whiskey selection, and the energy is great!
author: J N.

description:
This is a good review. I walk by all the time and was curious of what they were doing with this corner. So on a Saturday night I allowed the doorman to sweet talk me inside. The Saratoga is a dark and very luxurious looking bar classy romantic. The entire staff is very friendly and outgoing. 

I ordered a chicken dish and some french fries warning lots of garlic they were wonderfully presented I didn't eat much and took it to go. I'd go there again. 

I would compare this place to The Black Cat except they don't play jazz and the food and staff is much better!
author: SF T.

description: The Saratoga is absolutely fantastic. I haven't had one thing on the menu that wasn't delicious. Both food and drink! And we've had pretty much everything on the menu! The atmosphere and the service has been great as well! Love it and can't wait to go back.
author: Sarah J.

description:
They just opened 2 nights prior to us going, but things were running smoothly.  It was completely full upstairs when we arrived around 10:30 on a Friday, and lots of people were eating.  I had read about the food, which seemed highly anticipated, but we came after dinner, so we were too full.

I like the decor a lot - clean, classic but modern, interesting.  The display of the collection of rare bottles is nice with the back lit shelves and the library style ladder (I'm obsessed with getting one at home one day).

Drinks: 
1. The avenue: bourbon based; it's hard to find a passionfruit cocktail that's not overly sweet, but theirs is actually just the right amount of tartness. I'm guessing they use a fruit puree instead of syrup because most other ones I have outside are way too syrupy
2. Grand pendennis: gin based, with apricot brandy, bitters, lime. This is also on the tart side, not super sweet. I am not a huge gin fan, but it was a pretty good cocktail.. maybe a little strong on the bitters (in combination with the juniper from the gin)

Drink prices are pretty reasonable.  Presentation was nice - my drink had a flower with a tiny clothespin to attach it to the side of the nick and nora glass, which was nice since the garnish usually falls in my face when I take a sip. Also, I love their glassware - I saw some of the cutest mini coup glasses (not sure for which drink). 

The bartenders seemed experienced and calm/collected.  Extra nice touches: a doorman, water refills, and when I was looking for the bathroom, one of the servers personally walked me downstairs to show me where it was.

I would definitely come back.
author: Marilyn T.

description: Good drinks (the Negroni). Slow and inattentive service. Uninspiring food. Nice venue and atmosphere. Won't be returning for dinner, but maybe for happy hour some time.
author: Chris W.

description: Excellent date night. Real amazing and beautiful interior design and great atmosphere.
author: Mary N.

description: Fantastic Service. Great Food. Even better drinks. Our bartender was super knowledgeable and friendly and recommended some amazing whiskey from their tremendous selection
author: Sean M.

description:
I had an admittedly odd meal at The Saratoga. Not due to anything they did; I'd had a big lunch, was not super-hungry, and feeling a wee bit out of sorts, so did not want another big meal.
I'd never had chartreuse, picked what looked like one of the milder drinks, with mint, pineapple, sprinkle of nutmeg. Less sweet than many liqueurs, more herbal. 
Explained to helpful waitress I was going to just get a couple of small plates. Started with chicken liver pate. I know this is not to everyone's taste but I liked it and Saratoga's version was good. Crusty bread spread with pate and apple butter, grating of endive and very fine threads of apple - can't imagine what kind of tool they use to get them? Nice contrast of tastes & textures. All three salad options looked good. With difficulty, decided on carrots. A very generous portion of warm roasted carrots with avocado (could have had a little more avocado), tons of seeds, yogurt. Really, the carrots and pate were a very satisfying meal. 
Asked helpful waitress if they had any herbal tea. They don't, but she said they could steep some fresh mint, something I frequently do at home with mint from my garden. Ordered the rolls to eat with the mint tea. I don't want to know how much butter is in that bread dough! Obviously with that much butter they tasted good, if unhealthy. Came with "butter of the day", I think with nutmeg. 
Tried the ho-hos for dessert. That was the weak point. A nice concept, cute, generous portion but neither the cake nor the icing tasted especially chocolate-y. I liked the meringue. 
Might return for one of the other salads and an entree. This was post-ballet dinner and rest of season has dinners lined up, so next year.
author: Carol S.

description:
Great dinner and service! 
Best steak I had in a long time! Our waiter Alejandro was super and so professional! Just a pleasure all around! We are restaurant industry people and totally impressed from beginning of our our meal to the end! 
The Italian waiter came by for a chat and also totally made our night. All around great and we are looking forward to coming back again soon. 
Thank you!  
Kudos to the owners!
author: Elena N.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner prior to attending the Opera show Tarandot. I ordered the pork chops and my boyfriend had the rib eye steak. Let me just say.. the moment I took my first bite of the pork chop, I literally closed my eyes to take in all the goodness. It was perfectly made and full of yummy flavor. I know that sounds silly, but I'm being serious. Ha! Service was amazing.. and the atmosphere was idylic for a romantic night out, especially for a young couple in their 30's.
author: Tamara G.

description:
A cold characterless new establishment in one of the warmest and characterful neighborhoods in San Francisco.

I stopped in to try things out as a neighbor and had two drinks, the Green Goblin and Bamboo. Both were fine but pretty standard. The bartender was very cold and only had the bare minimum interaction with me required, the bar was very quiet too. The biggest problem is their prices, $30 before tip for 2 drinks on a Tuesday night in the Tenderloin is just silly. They are doing a SF mandate surcharge of 4% which is one of the highest I have ever seen, plus being a new establishment they should just have built it into their already high prices.

3 star quality at 5 star prices in my 1 star neighborhood.
author: Kurt N.

description: Such a fancy establishment.  I enjoyed a GIN highball drink and it was worth every penny.  Friendly bartenders too!
author: Cynthia A.

description: While the cocktails were excellent and the food good, I can't recommend this place because it was like eating inside a rock concert!  The noise level in the upstairs dining room was off the charts - on a Wednesday night.  The people sitting next to us left because of the noise.   I might go back for a cocktail right at opening time, before the noise level takes off, but I won't try to eat there again.
author: Donna L.

description: Great food and ambiance, good drinks. The Saratoga has a very extensive selection of cocktails and spirits, however they do come at quite a premium. And while the drinks look and sound attractive, in reality they are a little underwhelming. The real star of the evening, surprisingly enough, was the food, which was delicious and a bit more reasonably priced than the drinks. The rolls are a must-have, and between an order of those, a pair of apps (the fried chicken slider and toga tots), and a pair of lighter vegetable dishes (the tomato dip and kale salad), my partner and I were happily satisfied without feeling stuffed. While The Saratoga may seem more like a cocktail lounge from the photos, is the place to go for fantastic bar food, preferably after grabbing a few drinks elsewhere.
author: Cam O.

description: Excellent! Huge whiskey selection! Great service. Beautiful place! The bourbon and rye selection is huge, they have a really nice Japanese whiskey selection!
author: Liz D.

description: this is a good place to come and try a new cocktail, but unfortunately none of us were partaking at brunch.  four of us shared the jenga tots, which were delicious.  tater tots w/ lox, cream cheese, capers, tomatoes and onions.  so yum.  i also got the avocado toast, which was topped w/ smoked trout, tomatoes and a poached egg.  also good but a bit steep at $14.
author: Helen T.

description: The best food and drinks I've had in a very long time.  The restaurant is beautiful and classy.  The staff is super friendly and quick.  The drinks are strong and original.  The food is to die for.  This place is my new favorite place.  So, so, SO good.  I will definitely be back.
author: Ghazal S.

description:
I vacillated between giving two to four stars and settled on two because I won't return to this restaurant.
Five stars:  The hamburger!  Absolutely delicious!  One of the best burgers I have ever had  The service was great!
Two stars:  The french fries were ho hum, not very hot  or crisp when delivered to our table.
One star:  The pickled plate we returned since it was not actually pickled, but dressed.
So I will not return for two reasons: the inconsistency of the food, but primarily the uncomfortable atmosphere.  The volume of the music and the bass was accosting.  I am not sure if it is the building acoustics or the music volume or the combination of both, regardless, it makes dining very unenjoyable.   The waitress had to yell for us to hear her and we had to yell for her to hear us.  We had to yell at each other rather than converse at a normal volume.  By the time we left I was so relieved to be out of that restaurant!  Truly, the noise level was ear aching.
author: mi m.

description: Loving the Whiskey selection. haven't had food there yet, looking forward to going back to try it out.
author: Tiff W.

description: Definitely a fan of the food and friendly, attentive service here. We were lucky to nab a little table and tried several items.  The chicken liver, toga tots, daily special beef tartare, and burger were all really really good. The hamachi crudo and prawns were also really good, too.  There wasn't anything I didn't like. And the scotch butterscotch pudding was amazing and so were the ho ho's.  Can you tell I like this place?
author: Debbie L.

description:
NOTE: The service was pretty impeccable. Great, attentive staff and great decor/interior. PLEASE MAKE FOOD TO MATCH THIS EXPERIENCE! I'm sure that will improve as this rather new location gets more feedback and more people let staff know that this needs to be upped if it's going to sustain it's reputation as a $$$ restaurant. I probably won't be coming back for a while. 

I'll go into detail about my experience: 

The servers were amazing, very knowledgeable, kind, and attentive. They even fold your napkin when you get up to go to the restroom (service I've only experienced at places like Gary Danko.)

The dinner rolls were so dry, much too salty, and the butter had olives in it which was okay for me but not mentioned by the server or on the menu. My partner does not like olives and we wouldn't have ordered this considering that detail which was omitted on the menu. 

The poached tomato, although way too much to eat for one or two people, was delicious. It was so rich though. This needs to be mentioned as a dish for about 4 people to share if they don't want to be terribly full by the time other dishes come out. It also comes with about 6 pieces of bread which were wayyyyy over buttered, maybe the butter should be served on the side??? People like different amounts of butter! 

The warm carrot salad had a dreamy flavor, really delicious. BUT---the carrots were basically raw! I expected them to be charred or a little roasted at least. Some were too hard to eat delicately or even cut with a knife. Disappointing. :/ 

I did not have the burger, but my partner did. She only ate half. So you can determine what her feelings were on that. 

Over all, wonderful service that would keep me as a loyal customer, but please improve your food quality!
author: Cherish P.

description: Excellent cocktails ( get the green goblin). Excellent food and service. They go the extra mile here.
author: Nicole M.

description: Love the concept. 70% high end bar with excellent craft cocktails 30% Restaurant offering great food to go with your drinks. You can opt to come in for just a drink, a drink and snacks, or a drink and a full meal.
author: Gino M.

description:
New place which overall delivered quite well. 

1. Atmosphere: really awesome vibe, high ceilings, inspiring and impressive liqour bar/wall, well dressed waiters and hosts. 

2. Drinks: solid cocktails, ordered a few and although not quite as good as some of the places I have been in SF they were good and I am hoping they can refine their craft a bit here in the future.

3. Food: only had a few small things, including the burger which was ok. I generally enjoyed the burger but it was overly dressed, and the bun became a bit soggy and it was hard to really taste the meat, my suggestion here would be to put less dressing on it so the bun doesn't go soggy and the meat quality can stand out more, maybe it was a one off? Maybe they are still figuring this one out? Also tried some bread with truffle butter and it was great, and a lot of things on the menu look great so will definitely come back to try some other things. Oh and the bourbon pudding was incredible, but very spirit forward.

Right now it is a 4* for me, but I can see them getting a solid five if the food gets better in the future. 

Also, this area at night is still a bit sketchy but probably safe so just keep that in mind if you aren't familiar with the area or uncomfortable in sketchy areas.
author: Brent F.

description:
Had higher expectations I guess as it was coming from Spruce. But let's be clear, this is not really much of a restaurant. It's more of a great bar with fun and playful bar food. 
Upstairs is incredibly loud, no place for conversation and tables are poorly placed. We had reservations over 3 weeks out  and were still seated by the door (blasts of cold and twice hit by overzealous door openers!)
Our waitress was kind but she had three tables seated at the same time so she had difficulty keeping up (guess that is a hostess issue) Speaking of, the hostess was the only not-nice person. She simply shrugged off our concerns with table, service time, door issue, etc...,
Trust me, we are not picky people, we just wanted a nice evening of food and drink with friends, but the little things add up. 
We had to go get our own drinks at the separate bar downstairs because our drink order took over 15 minutes. 
The food is tasty fun (tater tots: amazing, bagna calda bread dip: delicious , 5-spice sliders: yummy, all desserts: wickedly good (cracker jacks included a prize, as it should!) 
The Cuban frank was lukewarm and burger was small. 
The bar is THE THING!! it is amazing and they make my favorite drink (The Brooklyn) but did not have Belvedere vodka. 
Ok, to really make my point regarding "is it a restaurant or a bar with food?": the menu is two pages food and 10 pages drinks 
We ended the evening by heading downstairs and it was significantly more quiet and intimate. Still small and low ceiling but, trust me, ask for a table downstairs if you want to dine/drink/converse. 
I know it's New and still working the kinks out so will try it again...downstairs
author: Laura M.

description: Amazing place, really flawless.  Best service I've ever had in my life. A little pricy but as always you get what you pay for.
author: Tyson C.

description: I actually got to meet the red headed chef from this fine establishment during my Christmas holiday in San Francisco. Come to find out he is a West Texas boy. Question ... how did he bottle up that mole to SF? should be bottled!
author: Geneva H.

description: We were in SF for 5 days over Christmas and this was by far my favorite restaurants. We had a good sized group so we ordered one of each off the menu I order to get a taste of everything. Even my 3 and 7 year olds loved the chicken and French fries. The service was excellent. My personal favorites are the tots and the mussels, but, we didn't have anything that wasn't delicious!
author: Isabel R.

description: I am not a big yelper primarily because I just don't have the time to post stuff, however I did want to give some love this this spot for my recent dining experience with my partner. I recently went in being lucky enough to have the night off and I have heard about the liquor selection here. The beauty of their bar setup, and we were surely not disappointed. Their menu size is aggressive, but nicely organized, and if you are a local lover of spirits, and whiskey this your spot! We started with some vino,  the mussels, then moved on to the kale salad which was on point! Our server Liz, was really great about pacing our order sizes, and was very welcoming and funny! I felt she was very attentive and personably. Our main course was the dry aged steak with the peppercorn sauce, with the shishito pepper side, and good lord sweet baby Jesus!!! I will go back just for that sauce in the steak!!! And surely not share it.... lol. Our server was kind enough to gift us some crackerjacks, which took me back to childhood. Overall a really great dining experience. Thank you for the great new memories.
author: Katrina V.

description: Finally a place with a cool vibe style chic and a great  ambiance. Kinda feel like home NYC. Great job!
author: Myriam N.

description: Burger was delicious, service was a welcome reminder of the charm of old-school (a la NYC) restaurant/lounges, and the place was aesthetically pleasing.  I recommend for a group of friends who want to dress up a little and feel like an adult again.
author: Rob P.

description: The appetizers were amazing. I had the rare beef tartar and my friend had the carrot plate (I can't recall the name) and it was all sooooooo delicious. The drinks are really good. I didn't get much help with trying to figure out what to try considering they have a million options to choose from so if you know what you like, this is the place to be at otherwise, go with the flow on drinks.
author: Olivia Z.

description: We waited patiently for this restaurant to open in our neighborhood, and it did not disappoint. We arrived early in the evening - only the second or third party there. Did not have reservations and were easily seated at the downstairs bar. The service was very attentive, even as the bar/dining room filled up. We ordered the Toga tots, chicken liver toast, warm carrot salad, and Saratoga burger. Everything was delicious and I wouldn't miss out on any of these items. We also had some very delicious cocktails, although I don't remember which ones now.
author: Jenny K.

description: Never go there. The treatment was spectacularly terrible. If I could give negative stars I would. We came from a charity event, dressed nicely and sober, and we ordered cocktails and the "manager" (probably a 20 year old kid that got slapped in high school) kindly notified us that we were too drunk and that we should pace ourselves with water... That never happened to me and I have been to many nicer and fancier places in the world... Hope they close soon!
author: Danilo R.

description: Great burger. The food came out quickly. Service at the bar was below average - it took a lot of effort to get the bartender's attention.
author: Vicki L.

description:
a really good meal! and just amazing service! im
all about this place. went with a group of 6 and we all got different things and ate off of everyones plate. everything was amazing! the steak had an amazing peppercorn sauce that was to die for. definitely coming back because it was worth the money...
author: Didi A.

description: The ambience is great! Toga tots and street corn are a+ but we didn't feel the mains were as good. Pork was solid but the mole fried chicken was completely cold in places and hot in others which makes me think it was reheated? I don't know but it was certainly the disappointment of the night. Staff are friendly and service is good. I would go back for a drink and light bite again but probably not a whole dinner.
author: Relle C.

description: Great food and drinks. Some of the wait staff need training - our waitress kept pouring our wines into the wrong glasses. Wouldnt have been an issue if 1-they weren't incredibly expensive wines or 2- she acknowledged the error in a way other than laughing and walking away.
author: Keenan M.

description: The food was top notch the kale salad with persimmons was perfectly seasoned. and the chicken was tastier than a steak. The drinks are highly crafted cocktails and very enjoyable. A place to go if it's a special occasion and ready to be surprised by the food.
author: N A.

description: Great atmosphere and fantastic attention to detail. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Good cocktails and comprehensive liquor list. This isn't, however, a great place for dinner in my opinion. There are a handful each of snack, vegetable, and entree options (all served a la carte), which results in a rather expensive and incomplete meal. I ordered the burger for $15 and it's an additional $7-8 for fries or tots. There are many fantastic upscale burger restaurants in the neighborhood, all much cheaper than $22. e.g. Hopwater Distribution ($14), Alta CA ($17), Rusty's ($15), Nopa ($17)... I just wish the Saratoga was a little more on the competitive side, and perhaps had a better notion of whether it wants to be a restaurant or a bar.
author: Eric N.

description: Stopped in here for pre-dinner drinks. Awesome vibes with strong artfully crafted drinks. Had the El Hacon mezcal drink. Will probably come back to try the pisco.
author: Sophie J.

description:
My wife and I have heard about this place opening- We were in the City for The Thanksgiving Weekend- and decided to try it- We are glad we did!!
