The layout and decor was warm and envying- The GM Miko was attentive to everyone- Chef Sullivan came to our table to check on our food- speaking of the food, we tried 5 different appetizers and an entry- all were unique, well thought out and totally enjoyable- we tried a few specialty cocktails and enjoyed them- the wine list was extensive and obviously was done with a great deal of thought- 

Next time we are in the City, we will definitely go back- BTW, don't go without trying the apple turnovers- they are a must and neither of us are big dessert fans
author: Terry R.

description:
Awesome experience at The Saratoga in San Francisco this evening. I love the music, the bar, the food, the decor! 1000 Larkin St. http://sf.eater.com/.../the-saratoga-san-francisco-restaurant...
They serve the comfort food you know and crave - re-invented with the sophistication you know is meant for your indulgence!  Try the Hamachi, the kale salad, the chicken sliders, and the Ho-Ho's for dessert.  Amazing, i
ncredible selection of spirits in the bar.  I think the staff is having as good a time as the guests.
http://sf.eater.com/2016/11/10/13589910/the-saratoga-san-francisco-restaurant-tendernob
author: Martha R.

description: This place is so cool! Impeccable drinks, incredibly cool vibe, great staff, and obviously a fantastic pedigree (see Spruce, etc). We will absolutely be back, probably several times.  The whiskey selection is insane and the food is delicious
author: Matt V.

description: great drinks, great food option, and great ambiance. people from all walk of life seem to gather here - and it's refreshing! def a fun, energetic place. great for dinner or just snacks / drinks.
author: Ruben K.

description: Amazing tots, drinks and baby kale salad. The chicken sliders were also great. The hamachi was a bit on the sweet side and so tiny/ not mind blowing. Great service though. A reservation is a must!
author: Natalia G.

description:
This place was very interesting! Tasty ! Nice service but no fish as a main course  on the menu . 
They have very nice hamachi appetizer and tomato spread !
author: Alia B.

description: Toga Tots- ok.   Burger- ok.   Fried apple hand pie- ok.  $28 for a glass of Cabernet- Really?
author: Fred X.

description: Loved this bar and atmosphere there. Maybe its not a place for food but honestly I totally like it. Great place to hang out and relax. Stuff was friendly and welcoming.
author: Michael B.

description: I really like this place. Our waiter was a bit awkward but the food, drinks and atmosphere overshadowed that. Wish they would offer more reservations as it's hard to walk in and grab a table (wait was an hour at 8:30pm on a Thursday night). The burger was awesome - highly recommend. Friend also really liked the kale salad. Hope they continue to be successful.
author: Robin P.

description: Incredible atmosphere and food. Every part of our experience there was amazing. They also have one of the largest chartreuse collections, so you have to try some while you're there!
author: Alexandra T.

description: Super swanky new restaurant with an awesome atmosphere. I ordered "The Walking Dead" to start and it came out with a flaming chunk of pineapple on top! What a surprise. I split the pickled plate with my friend and had the Bagna Cauda-Poached Tomato for my main. it was delicious! Highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Nina P.

description: Delicious cocktails, one of the best burgers I've had in a very long time, and EXTREMELY friendly service. Nice ambiance too. Coming again ASAP
author: Kathryn M.

description: I came here on a Friday night (3weeks ago) with no reservation  (not recommended). I called ahead and spoke to Dian the hostess she did inform me that they couldn't accommodate my party of 6 but that we could go to the bar area and receive full service. We went downstairs and Larissa the bartender got our cocktail order and quickly asked if their was anyway she could help. I told her my party of 6 situation and she LITERALLY MADE IT HAPPEN (Wow, thxx girl!).  Within 30 minutes she kept an eye on the lounge area and made sure my group was seated there. Once we squeezed into that area Alejandro was bomb.com. He was the best server. I highly recommend the steak, scallops, warm carrots, and honestly just everything!  My gin highball was impressively tasty. I can't wait to go back and bring more friends.
author: Debbie M.

description: best i have ever had, do not come to count calories, this place can cook!  chicken slider app was insane, buffalo pork wings are off the hook, best best best!
author: Scott W.

description:
Great Spot!  Sort of has the sophistication of Spruce with some of the energy of Park Tavern. I particularly like the contrasting vibes of upstairs and downstairs, where the upstairs feels like a busy brasserie and the downstairs feels more like a speak easy that serves great food. A really nice central staircase in the middle of the restaurant takes you between the two. 

The menu is short but very good. Steak Au Poivre and fries downstairs at 1 am is an instant classic and produces that "fuck, life is good" feeling that you get from NY's Balthazar around the same hour. It's a damn good steak. 

The restaurant has only been open a month so I'm sure it will get better.  A couple areas to work on---The bar staff doesn't quite have the polish with customers that Spruce's does, but they are also much busier, and Spruce is particularly good.  The drinks aren't as well made as Spruce's either but, again, they are much busier.
author: Alex H.

description: Drinks were good, the food was fine. Still would rather sit at the bar at Spruce and have the tartare there.
author: Alex L.

description: Wow...we just found a heavens little "niche" worth gold. This restaurant/bar is upscale, stylish and fun. The bar downstairs was managed by two very knowledgeable bartenders...Jeffrey & Sam. Brandon & Sarah were a gem. The background music & dim lights made a dazzling evening. Patrons were well behaved - actually friendly perhaps due to the fun & exciting environment. Finally a place to please my loving Jen, and God knows how difficult this  is!!!   P.S: for whiskey connoisseurs...this is the place to come!!
author: Fernando B.

description: 3 stars. 1 lost because the host (hostess was on a call) proceeded to tell me that the bar was full and that there was a waiting list for a "cocktail table". Which was fine, but he made no movement whatsoever to put us unto the "list" we had to ask him, while he starred at us awkwardly "so can you put us in the list then?" Anyway about 45mijs later we had little cocktail table. Waiter was very nice and the cocktails were great. I got the Cubano frank and my wife got the NY steak. We also got an order of the fries which were great as well. Just a heads up the cubano frank is a hot dog. The reason for the other star lost was my cubano frank was only warm, it wasn't hot. So it felt cheap. Overall taste was good and atmosphere cool. According to the guy at the table next to me though if you are just now trying to learn how to Skateboard you are a poser and a loser who works at Facebook. WTF? Oh and SF is training wheels for LA. Huh?!?
author: Tommy C.

description: Ok, my review is going to be different than many of the others. I read the other reviews and was prepared to be really impressed, but was not. I was left utterly unimpressed. From the moment we walked in, I hated it. I was greeted with cheesy 90's R & B music in what looks like a bar. I had higher hopes as we made our way downstairs to the table, but same music and smaller room. In fact, there may be 15 tables total. We noticed as the night went on, this is the way to the bathroom. All throughout dinner, people were strolling by to get to the restroom - very poor planning as it seemed strange and as out of place as everything else. I was also unimpressed with our server, who seemed to fumble over her words and do strange things. For instance, left ¼ inch of coffee in a carafe, so left the entire carafe on the table (there was plenty of room left in the cup). The coffee was HORRIBLE. We ordered the parker house rolls, which were served room temperature (not warm) with some type of gray goop. I asked and learned it was "olive butter." Flavor wasn't great, regular butter would have been a huge improvement. I had a salad, which was decent except for the bones of the leaves all over my plate. Next came the chicken liver appetizer, which came on bread - 3 total. The entire plate was covered in what I think was endive or radicchio leaves. Very strange to look at, like camouflage. I ordered the steak with peppercorn sauce. It was decent but nothing great. Tough meat in my opinion, but the sauce was tasty. Also ordered were The Cubano, which was a hot dog, with pork on top, and cheese, a lot of cheese. I would not order it again. Next were the sides - potato cocotte, and wine cooked mushrooms. The potatoes were NOT a cocotte, but were merely fingerling potatoes that looked like they were thrown on a cookie sheet and baked. They came with a ramekin that looked empty, but upon inspection had about 10 flakes of rock salt, which I used to cover everything I was eating. The mushrooms were beyond sweet (again, more rock salt to try to balance it) and were barely eaten. We skipped dessert altogether, and got our food packed up and left it on top of the nearest garbage can outside. I didn't want dinner to be a complete waste. I would definitely NOT go back.
author: Kath v.

description: Food was fantastic and the service was spot on. I didn't get a chance to drink the many selections of scotch and bourbon they have. But, I plan to next time I'm there. The tater tots are a must. I also love they're fun style of desserts. Ho hos and Cracker Jacks, are you kidding?  Not only do they taste amazing, but, there are prizes in the Cracker Jack box. Every dish, except the poached tomato, was delicious.  The tomato was a little too acidic and the flavors of the tomato were too strong. But, the broth and toast were very tasty.  You must go to check out this place. Btw, I almost never write reviews. But, this one was worth it.  I only write reviews if I love a place or can't stand it.
author: David W.

description: The food is mediocre and relatively uninteresting, especially for the price. The best thing in the menu is the chicken sliders, everything else makes you nostalgic for your other favorite San Francisco restaurants. By far the worst thing about this place is the waiters, they're rude and unprofessional. Go there if you like to be manipulated.
author: Mohamad T.

description: Wow. Just Wow. Went for a quick drink and stayed for a few and some yummy food! Beautiful new buildout, super friendly staff and the manager was great! Try the "Walking Dead" drink it comes on fire! The burger is to die for and the chicken slider was mouth watering juicy! #MyNewSpot
author: William B.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood! Fantastic service, incredible drinks and really good food. Highly recommend.
author: Chelsea W.

description: I went to Saratoga for my birthday with three friends to get a classy but fun dinner. We started at the bar to get drinks and had a few questions about the wine. The server was very helpful and offered us a tasting (incredibly generous). For dinner we received complementary garlic fries because of a slight delay in seating (which wasn't a problem because of the good bar area), which were very tasty and unique. We also got the chicken tenders and tater tots for appetizers. I will say that these dishes are incredibly unique--great balance of flavors and well presented. For dinner I got the flattened chicken and my friends got the burger. The flattened chicken had a light coat of herbs and spices and was cooked perfectly. The accompanying greens balanced the flavor of the chicken very well. The burgers were also delicious. The service was also great--the server checked on us multiple times and the chef came out to see how we enjoyed the meal. You can really appreciate the originality and creativity that went into the menu here. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Adam P.

description: Food was so-so. The flavors of the Spicy Pork Belly Buns were good but the dough was burnt on the bottom, hard on top, undercooked inside. The mushrooms were worse than anything you'd find at a strip mall deli -- simply raw button mushrooms in red wine. The steak ($32) was a nice piece of beef that was drowned in one of the saddest pepper sauces I've ever had. Not all the much pepper and it had a very strange texture/mouthfeel -- it managed to have both a greasy feel and taste like it had some sort of thickener like flour or hydrolyzed protein. The service was up and down, mostly down. There was a mix up with the reservation for our party of five but they did their best to accommodate us. Our wine choice took three tries to get right. The server blamed the noise level (i.e. he couldn't hear what I ordered), which was in the low 90 dBls according to my iPhone app. The first bottle of Kistler Chardonnay ($95) was properly chilled (maybe too chilled) the second was warm. The ambiance is OK, but this is much more a lounge than a restaurant. It is certainly not worth the $$$ for the quality of the food.
author: Tom M.
